headline: Best Butternut Squash Soup Ever
description: Chicken stock is the base for this pureed butternut squash soup seasoned with garlic, thyme, cumin, and allspice.
name: Best Butternut Squash Soup Ever
recipeIngredient: 0.5 butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut into 1-inch cubes
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat; cook the onion, garlic, and thyme in the hot butter until the onion has softened, about 5 minutes. Add the squash and chicken stock; bring to a simmer and cook until the squash is tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Crumble the bouillon into the soup; season with cumin, allspice, salt, and pepper; remove from heat.

Pour the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway. Hold the lid of the blender in place with a kitchen towel and carefully start the blender using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree. Puree in batches until smooth and pour into a serving bowl. Alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the soup in the pot.

review.reviewBody: I followed the recipe as written. Since it only yields 4 servings, I doubled the ingredients to yield 8 servings. I was disappointed at the final product. It was very bland and not orange in color like most butternut squash soups I've had. I will search other butternut squash soup recipes. I think adding purr-aid carrots would help with the orange color, maybe some heavy cream and a cinnamon stick or two.

This is an excellent recipe. My first attempt was a little less spectacular than I'd hoped, but I used a squash called Honeynut, similar to Butternut, that turned out to have a very mild flavor, not as squash-like as I enjoy. I also used chicken broth instead of stock. I'll make it again with the correct ingredients.
I added a sweet potato also, one of my favs! Going to roast squash next time and try with Vegetable broth for Veggie family and friends.

This recipe is really good I followed the recipe except that I too roasted the Butternut Squash and onions and the garlic so this made it a yummy recipe. When I do serve this I will serve it with some pumpkin seeds on top and a squirt bottle of Sour Cream I also use the Crema and that‚Äôs a little bit easier on the palette then I think the regular Sour Cream has. I almost forgot to add is I grate Allspice with the Crema, Pumpkin Seeds it add flavor. Well enjoy and happy fall.üçÅüçÅ
If you roast the onion ,garlic ,cubed squashn till golden, the Carmelisation is wonferful.
What could be better - winter warming soup.

I cooked the onion & thyme in half bacon fat & butter then added the garlic for the last 1-2 minutes. Cubed the squash & tossed with salt, pepper & olive oil the baked 30 minutes @ 400. Combine in stock pot with chicken broth & puree. Add cumin, allspice, bouillon & additional chicken broth if needed & puree again. When serving, sprinkle with crushed red pepper & bits of bacon.

I split the squash, brushed with EVOO and baked flesh up until tender. None of this cubing stuff, no time. I followed the recipe but I used the entire squash; all other ingredients as listed. So good!!

This! Was! Amazing!!! I oven roasted the squash @ 400 for 30 minutes. Did that make a difference? I don‚Äôt know as I still had to cook in the broth to cook the squash all the way. Roasting method only got me halfway there. I also had to use dried thyme (no fresh available)- which? A couple pieces of thyme here or there were inedible but overall? We were blown away by the great flavor! This was my first butternut squash soup attempt ever and darn pleased with the results! Thank you for posting an awesome recipe I will make again and for sure every fall (and some winters!!)!!
I found this recipe very easy to make. It was a hearty soup that everyone enjoyed. I will definitely be making this recipe again.

This soup is the best butternut squash soup ever. I double the recipe, so we can eat more of it. It is so easy to make (except peeling and dicing the squash) but oh so worth it. I have tried roasting the squash but I prefer dicing and cooking in the broth as the recipe calls for.

This recipe is so versitile. I've made this recipe about a dozen times. My favorite thing to do is portion 4-5 bowls and add a different spice to each bowl for weeklong variety . I like mine spicy and use chili powder, curry or Cajun spice. Others I've liked are cardamom or winter/breakfast spices like nutmeg or cinnamon. The base soup can be used to wow guests with plating color for that special dish.
I don‚Äôt know what went wrong. I‚Äôm allergic to onion so maybe that was what would have given it more flavor. But it was the consistency that didn‚Äôt taste quite right.
Delicious!
It was tasty and low in calories! I loved it.

Great recipe, my only criticism is that ‚Äú1/2 butternut squash‚Äù is not a very good unit of measurement. Pounds, ounces, even cups would be better. They range a lot in size! I used a whole one and had to adjust the rest of the recipe by eye. It‚Äôs delish though!

Roasted large bnut squash (approx. 3 lbs.) and a sweet potato (Cause I love ‚Äòem). Saut√©ed a large onion with the garlic. Used drIed thyme. Did not use Allspice (personal pref) but did add a pinch cayenne. After blending, added 3/4c light cream. 
This soup is given better topped with bacon bits or crunchy prosciutto.

This is my first tie making this soup and it came out delish!! I didn't change much. Only used 1/2 and onion because was rushing. We don't watch our salt so went for reg. chicken broth as opposed to low sodium. Skipped the pepper and coconut milk because my family are not fans. This made it much lower calorie too (not a bad thing). Added 1/2 an apple, a pinch of cinnamon. It was perfect - just enough sweetness due to the apple I'm sure. Would def. make again. Thanks!!

Delicious! I, like other reviewers, prebaked, 350F for about 30 minutes. I used a whole squash (noted people who used half found it thin). I omitted bouillon‚Äîtoo much salt for me. I‚Äôm trying to watch fat, so I‚Äôm glad this didn‚Äôt have cream. I found it very creamy and full flavored just as is. I‚Äôll be making this very often!
I used a bag of frozen butternut squash (because that's what I had on hand) and added some buttermilk near the end. It was very good and easy enough (especially with an immersion blender).
Love it
smooth and wonderful.
I have made this recipe several times it is a favorite in my family. we could eat it every day or week
Great recipe!

Delicious and easy to make soup. I added some half & half at the end, only because it was near the expiration date and I wanted to use it up. That made the soup a little creamier, but it was not necessary. I will be making this again .
The soup was absolutely delicious. I followed the recipe and it was perfect.
Quick, easy, delicious.
LOVE IT!! I added some Cayenne pepper, ginger, and a whole butternut squash. Also added more thyme and heavy cream to it. I made a whole bunch but I just love every bite!!!!
I loved it but my wife didn‚Äôt. Oh well.
Nice flavors. I used the spices from this recipe to "fix" a recipe that wasn't so good.
Good flavor! I did add 1 celery, one carrot, and one potato. Also roasted squash. Very good thanks for the recipe!!
This was sooo easy. I had all the ingredients, even the bullion. Only difference for me is I put apple sauce in it for The heck of it. Thanks for the recipe.
I will definitely make this again! No change necessary to basic recipe!
Lovely full body, filling soup. Great flavor.
Only change I made was to add green chilies. Flavors were great.
Added 2 small sweet potatoes, 2tsp of brown sugar and a pinch of nutmeg. Perfect!

Added:
1 zucchini
fresh cilantro
2 chicken bouillon
white pepper
2 tomatoes
1 onion
water

No chicken or salt. Slow cooked & smushed.
ate as soup also poured over rice
It was amazing. I used vegetable broth in place of chicken. The pinch of cumin totally makes this soup.
Pretty good! I used home canned squash and had to estimate the herbs as I don't have any fresh this time of year. Hope my guys like it as I may have to make this more often! Good cold weather soup!
This is truly a remarkable recipe. It's very simple, but utterly delicious on a cold winter day. I've made it two or three times and it always gets gobbled up quick.

I made it! very easy, wife and I both loved it.
It is now a part of my best tasting recipes,
Only thing I added was some sliced ginger.
Excellent soup! Will definately make this again! Thank you!

Look at the 5-star reviews and you'll see the truth: everyone has to doctor this recipe to make it good. I made this exactly as written and it was amazingly disappointing. It absolutely needs something to make it a bit thicker, and taste is bland.

Loved this soup and my 10 year old even loved it too! I didn't add the bouillon cube (didn't have one) but the soup didn't suffer for it. Still delicious! I like that it's the tiniest bit sweet but not overly so as some butternut soups are. More savory and creamy.
Loved this soup! However, I made several modifications - 2 cups homemade (from beer butt chicken) + 2 cups coconut milk and 1 tsp ginger! Delicious soup.
So delicious. Definitely will be making again. Made as directed. Only change I made was I roasted a whole squash and added a sweet Potato for sweetness. So yummy
This was delicious!! The flavors went together very nicely.
Absolutely wonderful. The change I made was that I roasted the butternut squash first. It was delicious!!
This really is the best Butternut Soup recipe I have ever made! Thank you! Loved it!
Fast and delicious!!!!
It is easy and delicious! I roasted the squash first and added an apple with squash
Loved it Added a tab of butter when i served it!

Restaurant quality! I was doubling the recipe so I was sort of winging it slightly. Used about 4 cups of cubed squash, a whole onion, 6 cups of stock, added a little cinnamon and probably a half tablespoon or so of brown sugar. Then as I was pureeing each batch in my food processor, I added just a little more salt and a couple swirls of half and half. Perfect! I'll be making this recipe for years to come I'm sure.
Great recipe! Will definitely make it again. Liked that there wasn‚Äôt any heavy cream or such in this one.
Made for my son who loves squash soup & he said too much carrot favor.
I've made a curry, butternut squash soup for years. I wanted to try a more traditional version, and chose this recipe. Yum. I followed the recipe verbatim and loved the final product.
I gave it four stars because it seemed to lack something. Otherwise an ok recipe.

Delicious !! Will be making again. I too roasted the squash 3lbs. Already peeled and cut on 400 degree oven for about 30 min until just cooked. Used lemon thyme,pinch of curry, turmeric, ground ginger and allspice. Immersion blender to finish. Will top with either plain yogurt or sour cream (low fat) and pumpkin seeds!
used a whole butternut squash
This soup is delicious! I prefer my soup a little more thicker and creamier so I made a few changes. I added the whole squash, 1 apple and approx. 2/3 cup of cream.
Not bad but didn't WOW! Me
Really nice, savoury soup. I used about 3/4 of a roasted butternut and about 1 cup of steamed carrots that I had on hand. All else according to the recipe. Will definitely make again.

I had frozen butternut squash from the garden last year.....about 4 cups. I like a bit more garlic so I added more. I also used Better than Bouillon dissolved in 4 cups of water for the broth. I loved the fresh thyme and the rest of the ingredients. I will definitely make it again. So quick, simple and delicious! Topped with French's crispy onions and crispy bacon!
Great soup flavor. Healthy choice.

I made this soup but add half a cup of coconut milk to it. This made it creamy with a hint of coconut. Very good. Might actually be 5 stars but I have the flu and my taste buds are a bit off. Bon appetit!
I added a sweet potato because I had it and about 1/2 of almond milk. Also about 1/2 tsp cinnamon.
Best soup ever! Used vegetable broth instead of chicken. Only 3 cups of broth and 1/2 vegetable bullion cube. Doubled cumin and left out allspice but added a dash of cayenne. Perfect!

I followed the suggestion of another user and added 1 small apple to the recipe, I will absolutely make this again! I'm a spice lover, so I was a bit more generious with the allspice and cumin, and used 3 garlic cloves. DELICIOUS!

As a vegetarian I used vegetable broth instead of chicken. I used packaged, fresh butternut squash cubes. A large package. I didn‚Äôt use cream because I wanted to keep the fat down. The soup was still thick and creamy. Added a little cayenne. It is easy and fast to make. I sprinkled pumpkin seeds on soup when serving. Really good. I love butternut squash. My husband does not, but he was very enthusiastic about this soup. Will definitely make this recipe again.
good soup, expected it to be a bit thicker, but really good flavor
Everyone loved it. Really easy. Used Instant Pot to cook whole butternut squash (no piercing or slicing), then peeled and cubed it and added it to broth.
VERY TASTY I used frozen cubed squash and roasted before mixing with onion. Added cream while pureeing. Company also enjoyed. Worth making.
Amazing flavor for so little ingredients!

I added 3/4 Apple in w the squash like another reviewer suggested. I roasted the squash w a bit of oil similar to someone suggesting brooling. My squash was small so I used the whole one. It was a tad bit sweet. I loved it but have had butternut squash soup before. My wife was originally a skeptic but was very happy w it. She said it tasted like a cream soup but I assured her it wasn‚Äôt. She really enjoyed the taste. Will make again.

I doubled the recipe otherwise made it as directed in my pressure cooker. It came out very thin. I added a second whole butternut squash two handfuls of carrots a block of cream cheese some fresh ginger and a pinch of cayenne. Pressure cooked it again. And it was delicious!
I doubled the recipe to serve a family lunch. Turned out great. There were no leftovers.

Great recipe! The hardest part was cutting the squash...I plan on buying it pre cubed next time if I can. Fit the bill for us, (we can't do dairy). I did roast the squash first, and I fried bacon very crispy and served it crumbled in the individual bowls. I also plan on doubling the recipe next time, and freezing half for a quick go to dinner.
Like many others, I roasted the butternut squash in the oven first (with olive oil and salt and pepper) and then added the juice of one orange and orange zest (saw this in another recipe). Delicious!

This truly is THEE best Butternut Squash Soup ever! I read the reviews and took the advice of several reviewers - I used a whole squash (although on the small side), roasted the squash w/a little butter in a 400 degree oven for 5 minutes before adding to the saut√©ed onion, garlic & thyme, used a little less than 4 cups chicken stock, added a little cream after pureeing the soup, and it was so delicious! Only complaint, this one recipe didn't make enough for leftovers! It only served up 4 small bowls, so next time I would double or triple it1
recipe is good, but it should advise people to roast the squash first. I also added an apple and a splash of milk and a bit of cayenne pepper.

Love this soup. Instead of boiling, I roast the squash basted with butter and seasoned with salt pepper and herbs, along with the onion and also add a bell pepper. This adds a smokey essence to the soup. Pur√©e the balance of ingredients with roasted veggies and broth. So yummy!!

Only change is that I use a full squash. I roast it ahead of time in large pieces and it makes it easy to scoop out of the skin I will also use dried thyme if I don't have fresh herbs Use my immersion blender to make it smoothe This is a delicious soup. Anyone I've made it for loves it. Also it has all healthy ingredients save for a small amount of butter.

Simple and easy to make. This is my first time to make squash soup and it turned out great. I used a local variety of squash (I'm from the Philippines) which is a bit sweeter so I balanced it out with a bit more chicken stock and extra salt. I used homemade chicken stock. I didn't have allspice so I used dashes of cloves, cinnamon, and nutmeg. It's creamy enough w/o any cream. An indulgent soup w/o the guilt :)
This isn't bad for a squash soup. That being said, I usually hate squash soup. I doubled the soup and added a can of tomatoes (pur√©ed) and it was a great soup.

This is a fantastic recipe. I have made it several times now and have modified it a bit to suit the tastes in our house.
I used a whole squash and substituted nutmeg for the allspice. Also added some rosemary and it came out beautifully. Everyone I serve it to absolutely loves it!!!

Fantastic soup, and it's perfect for the winter and fall. The recipe doubles nicely. The flavor of the soup can be enhanced by roasting the butternut squash with the garlic and thyme first. This gives it a very rich flavor. Thank you for the wonderful recipe, Chester!

Made it with half veggie and half chicken broth and added 1 Granny Smith apple. At first I was looking for a sweet flavor instead of savory, but the more I ate it grew on me. Used 3/4 of a teaspoon of dried thyme and 20 oz cut up squash.
It was soooo delicious...... I used the whole squash. Will definitely made again soon!

Used two butternut squashes, an apple and a ripe pear. Adjusted other ingredients proportionately. Before blending added two cups of low fat half n half. Smooth and delicious without the perfume taste sometimes found in other butternut squash soup recipes. With fresh cornbread on the side, a perfect snowy day fire side meal made from my pantry and refrigerator with no need to venture beyond home.
I used whole squash-- and brought it to a boil for 15 min

This is the first time I've made Butternut squash and I love it! Made it pretty much by the recipe, except I used more squash, a little extra allspice and used Italian seasoning instead of thyme {cuz I didn't have it} I thought it was sweet enough without adding apples like some had said they did. I appreciate that it didn't have heavy cream in it. Next time I will try roasting the squash to see if it could actually be better.

This soup is easy to make and very good! The only changes I made was I replaced some of the chicken stoc, (about 1/2 of it) with stock made from bouillon because I didnt have enough stock. I also added 1/4 block of cream cheese to it when a pur√©ed it. That added a much richer flavor.

I love butternut squash and butternut squash soup! I roasted the squash with olive oil and garlic cloves till it was tender. Roasting gives it such flavor; would not consider boiling the squash. Did not add bouillon cubes, did not find it necessary. Will definitely make this again.
I wasn't crazy about the spices in this soup. I won't make it again.
So good and great suggestions from others. My only suggestion...sprinkle on some pepitas (dried pumpkin seeds) right before serving. Looks great and the slight crush in fun.

I made this soup in large quantity for our church's Old Fashioned Christmas. I pretty much kept the recipe the same, but had some pumpkin and sweet potato that got added in with the butternut squash. The spices in this are right on and it was a favorite for sure. will definitely make again.
Made it this afternoon for my wife's lunch. We both enjoyed it. She had seconds and she hadn't been able to eat for two days. Will make again.
I made it exactly as written. The soup has a delicious delicate flavor. I just couldn't get enough!
I did not have any bouillon to add, but it was delicious without it. I roasted the squash first. I loved that it was thick, flavorful and rich tasting without the addition of cream.
